definition: Pompeium, Roman town in Bay of Naples destroyed by eruption of Vesuvius in 79/Pompey (Roman general)
to bank up with earth/to cultivate (lit. or fig.)/to train (people)

sentences.english: This would have caused a lot of ' sluggishness' in Pompey's ranks.
sentences.chinese: 这在庞培军队中导致了许多迟滞。

sentences.english: Pompey the Great and Julius Caesar were fighting each other for control of Rome.
sentences.chinese: 庞培和凯撒大的战斗，罗马控制对方。

sentences.english: Once, Pompeii was a busy city of 22000 people.
sentences.chinese: 以前，庞培是一个拥有两万两千人口的繁华城市。

sentences.english: They do not see them because Pompeii has no people.
sentences.chinese: 然而游客却看不到庞培城的居民。

sentences.english: A new trouble was in store for pompeii .
sentences.chinese: 一场新的灾难即将向庞培袭来。

sentences.english: Panic spreads among Pompey's young soldiers as they turn and flee.
sentences.chinese: 庞培的年轻士兵被吓得四处逃散。

sentences.english: Today, more than 250 years since excavations started.
sentences.chinese: 从挖掘庞培城开始至今，250多年过去了。

sentences.english: They can also be unintended caches such as at Pompeii.
sentences.chinese: 他们也可以是随意的容器，就像在庞培古城一样。

sentences.english: In addition to Pompey, the Optimates faction included most of the Roman Senate.
sentences.chinese: 除了庞培，贵族派包括了几乎所有的罗马议员。

sentences.english: He had superiority in cavalry, both he and Ceasar knew that.
sentences.chinese: 庞培有骑兵优势，他和恺撒都明白这一点。

sentences.english: My wife and I were touring Italy and had spent the day at Pompeii.
sentences.chinese: 我和妻子去意大利旅游，花了一天时间参观庞培。

sentences.english: According to tradition, it was founded in 75 BC by Pompey the Great as a military settlement.
sentences.chinese: 相传西元前75年由庞培创建，当作屯兵之地。

sentences.english: Pompeii is no longer a buried city.

definition: Brutus (name)/Marcus Junius Brutus (85-42 BC), late Roman Republic politician who conspired against Julius Caesar/Lucius Junius Brutus (6th c. BC), founder of the Roman Republic
Franco (name)/Generalissimo Francisco Franco Bahamonde (1892-1975), Spanish dictator and head of state 1939-1975
Pompeii, ancient Roman town near Naples, Italy
Thebes, place name in ancient Egypt/Thebes, ancient Greek city state
Syracuse, Sicily/also written 錫拉庫薩|锡拉库萨[Xi1 la1 ku4 sa4]
Pericles (c. 495-429 BC), Athenian strategist and politician before and at the start of the Peloponnesian war
